qas.question: What was the nationality of the people who settled Richmond in 1609?
In what year was the current city of Richmond founded?
What famous speech did Patrick Henry give in Richmond?

answers.text: Give me liberty or give me death

qas.question: In what building did Patrick Henry give his famous speech?
Who was the author of the Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom?

context: The site of Richmond had been an important village of the Powhatan Confederacy, and was briefly settled by <a0_0>English<a0_0/> colonists from Jamestown in 1609, and in 1610–1611. The present city of Richmond was founded in <a1_0>1737<a1_0/>. It became the capital of the Colony and Dominion of Virginia in 1780. During the Revolutionary War period, several notable events occurred in the city, including Patrick Henry's "<a2_0>Give me liberty or give me death<a2_0/>" speech in 1775 at <a3_0>St. John's Church<a3_0/>, and the passage of the Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom written by <a4_0>Thomas Jefferson<a4_0/>. During the American Civil War, Richmond served as the capital of the Confederate States of America. The city entered the 20th century with one of the world's first successful electric streetcar systems, as well as a national hub of African-American commerce and culture, the Jackson Ward neighborhood.
